description.narrative: The JR proposes a multi-sectoral response to the IDP crisis in Cabo Delgado, in line with the HRP 2021. The JR will be implemented in Cabo Delgado, being the province with the highest needs and will prioritise the following districts: Mecufi, Chiure, Metuge, Montepuez, and Ancuabe. The overarching objective of the JR is to provide 101,185 affected people with life-saving and life-sustaining goods and services CARE will implement WASH, NFI and Protection projects in Chiure and Montepuez. The other JR partners are: PLAN, Cordaid, Oxfam, SOS and Tearfund.

title.narrative: Number of people provided with non-food items

comment.narrative: Given the late activation of funding codes from SSC, the procurement process for NFIs was only initiated on July 2nd. CARE anticipates NFIs arriving into the warehouse by September, with beneficiary selection, registration and validation beginning immediately after. Once beneficiaries and sites are selected, CARE will begin distribution of NFIs. Selection will consider gaps identified by the Shelter cluster and priority areas by the government.

title.narrative: Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

comment.narrative: Given the late activation of funding codes from SSC, the procurement process for WASH NFIs was only initiated on July 2nd. CARE anticipates NFIs arriving into the warehouse by September, with beneficiary selection, registration and validation beginning immediately after. Once beneficiaries and sites are selected, CARE will begin distribution of WASH NFIs. Selection will consider gaps identified by the WASH cluster and priority areas by the government.

title.narrative: Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, monitoring and/or evaluation of the programme

comment.narrative: This will be reported after the distributions occur, scheduled toward the end of the project (October/November)

title.narrative: Number of persons reached by the implementation of specific GBV prevention measures

comment.narrative: Under the reporting period, CARE conducted two awareness-raising sessions on GBV, Protection and MHPSS. In these sessions, CARE covered modules such as understanding the root causes of GBV, GBV consequences, PSEA, positive coping mechanisms for trauma and available SEA reporting mechanisms. In the next reporting period CARE will be increasing the frequency of awareness-raising sessions, producing locally-adapted IEC material and broadcasting gender and protection messaging on the radio (3 x a day). All messaging has been reviewed and approved by the Protection cluster and GBV AoR subcluster. Additionally, CARE has conducted a GBV service mapping activity to identify services needed and has also selected GBV caseworkers and Community Outreach Activists who will begin their formal training in the next reporting period. All these activities will allow CARE to reach more beneficiaires in the next reporting period.
